review_blob: Bottle from Hop Hideout, Sheffield. Lashings of chocolate, roasted, wood notes. Good body, mid range not oil slick for 10%er boozy licks.
Bottle from Hop Hideout, Sheffield. Tart rounded notes, coats the mouth fully. Puckering, smooth, impressive and will definitely buy again.
Can from Hop Hideout, Sheffield. Lemon sherbet, citrus on nose. Juicy flavour, full mouth flavour providing pleasurable and highly drinkable DIPA.
Bottle from Hop Hideout, Sheffield. Rich straw haze colour, 11% hop bomb, big juicy hop aroma. Boozy, sharp after bite.
Draught from Hop Hideout, Sheffield. Orange hue, tropical aroma, sweet licks, piney, bitter bite on finish. Solid US IPA.
Bottle from Hop Hideout, Sheffield. Thin, funky aroma, lightly fruity. Golden colour, fruit little one dimensional, but hint tart and refreshing
Delicate single hop Mosaic keg from Hop Hideout, Sheffield. Clean, tropical notes, massively refreshing, biscuit crispness.
Keg/growler at Hop Hideout, Sheffield. Smooth, rich, luscious, liquorice, chocolate, hint roast no bitter after finish. Delicious.
beer_name: Buxton / Omnipollo Chocolate Ice Cream Brown Ale

review_blob: Bottle from Hop Hideout, Sheffield. Earl Grey Dark Ale with bitter cocoa & biscuit notes, smooth dark beer with hint of citrus. Very impressed with this new Belgian brewery in the centre of Brussels.
Bottle Hop Hideout. Sweet, super sweet, yet dreamy easy drinking for +11%. Salty liquorice twang. Multi dimensional
beer_name: Siren / Evil Twin Barrel Aged Even More Jesus VIII - Hazelnut

review_blob: Bottle Hop Hideout. Sweet with rock candy. Herbal pale ale. Bretts Belgian style strong pale.
Bottle from Hop Hideout. Minty, lactose, chocolate stout party. Good but odd.
beer_name: Weird Beard / Kew Brewery A World Without Dave

review_blob: Bottle from Hop Hideout. Brewed US, new screen print on bottle. Rich, luscious, lots going on all in balance. Coffee, cacao, chilli, nutmeg and more but all very rounded. Challenged the taste buds in a good way.
beer_name: Chris Banker / Insurgente / Stone Xocoveza Mocha Stout

review_blob: Growler from Hop Hideout. Delicious, light and refreshing. Stone fruit, sweet apricot, funk, lightly tart. Golden light straw. Extremely balanced. Happily drink again and again.
Can from Hop Hideout. Light, citrus, hopped up aroma, grapefruity. Easy go-to beer. Bitter linger bite, pleasing.
Bottle, Hop Hideout, Sheffield. Dark ruby red colour. Fruity berry aroma. Tart, big raspberry flavour. Enviable fruit factor, delicious.
Bottle, Hop Hideout, Sheffield. Lemon, pithy, dry quickly dissipating flavour.
Bottle, Hop Hideout, Sheffield. Nice straw hue, little dank on flavour and aroma. Rich slightly creamy body, lactose?
beer_name: Wiper and True Citrus and Sevens

review_blob: Bottle Hop Hideout, Sheffield. Orangey, tart, refreshing, light. Highly drinkable. Citrus, clean and delightful.
Massive chocolate aroma, roasted tempered bitterness. Sweet potentially lactose element. Pleasing rich body. Excellent taste & overall tasty beverage
Mango, even hint strawberry on nose. Creamy body. Very appealing taste. Golden straw haze. Fruity IPA.
Its like opening a can of pure summer from @toolbeer shame its wintry outside. Can you have a session sour? This may well be just that 3.8% lightly sour Gose, delicate orange, super refreshment.
Big juicy sour IPA, gooseberry juice added to beer from info on label. citrus, hazy, heavily sour, lively.
Depth of aroma and flavours impressive. Layers of vanilla, roasty chocolate. Less chilli than I would have imagined but not minding the lack of it.
Little thin for me but pleasant rounded roasted flavours from this dark mahogany brew. Interesting idea to use saison dupont yeast for this stout, maybe a British influence in style?
Herbal, extremely dry and bitter lingering finish. Hay and grapefruit. Not yet convinced on Brett IPAs but thats just me! Im sure after a few more, my opinion will change.
Huge pleasing coffee aroma, nice rounded chocolate notes, dark mahogany in colour. Little vanilla kick that is the reminiscent marshmallow flavour. Some savoury notes from the chestnut syrup.
Massive grapefruit aroma, sweet malt, easy drinking. Medium body, nice carbonation. Prefer various hopped Highwire to be honest rather than grapefruit version.
Dry, savoury, bready - nice funk, very drinkable. Yeast heavy as you would expect with dry long lasting bitterness.
Solid wheat beer, easy drinking. Would have liked more aroma to come through from the yeast used.
